column4: heya, since i upgraded to heron my dialog boxes (e.g. password dialog for thunderbird) always open up maximised - any ideas why?
do all windows do that? are you using compiz?
yes, using compiz. no, my terminal windows don't open like that (gnome-terminal)
check ccsm > Window Placement > Placement Mode
make sure it's not on "Maximized"
on Maximised where? sorry, closed xchat since each time i switch windows it seems to refuse keyboard focus :P
oh, are you sure you have a window manager running at all?
lol, yeah, compiz is running, and I can see its settings
you see fade effects when you click on menus?
nope
does windows key + E do anything?
no, but that might be because i've remapped the windows key with xmodmap
you have titlebars on your windows?
yes. seriously, i'm running compiz. ps ax |grep compiz shows that
lol just making sure; windows not getting keyboard focus almost always means there's no WM running :)
the setting I wanted you to check was Place Windows > Placement Mode

actually its worse than that. from time to time when i switch desktops the windows are actually frozen in some way - then when i minimize and maximise again suddenly everything works (and i see all the chat on #ubuntu)
placement mode: smart ?
ahh, are you using any unofficial plugins? that's usually caused by buggy plugins that don't damage windows enough
just the normal plugins and the compiz-fusion-plugins
hmm, it might be one of them then, but it's unlikely
thanks though - i'll try and pin down exactly when this happens
i wonder if its something grabbing focus. like k3b - which has been acting odd for me
